title: News. Views. Hughes - October 14, 2019 (17:00 ET)
text:
Johnson & Johnson faces more than 100,000 lawsuits and has already been ordered to pay out billions in compensation for their products' side effects and for contributing to the opioid crisis. J&J remains the most profitable company in the US. RT America's Sara Montes de Oca reports for News.Views.Hughes.

Conservative commentator Steve Malzberg reacts to the resignation of Shepherd Smith from Fox News and other notable moments in recent media. Then Democratic strategist Ameshia Cross and Tony Lazzaro of Big Tent Republicans PAC join Scottie Nell Hughes to discuss the disturbing meme video of President Trump appearing to shoot and stab critics, political rivals and personifications of liberal media outlets in the “Church of Fake News.” The video was shown, allegedly without official sanction, at a political event at Trump National Doral Miami resort. They also discuss protesters' stealing and burning of a cart full of MAGA hats outside a Trump rally.

Ned Ryun of American Majority joins Scottie Nell Hughes to discuss Hunter Biden’s pledge to divest from business with foreign companies and renunciation of his role with a Chinese-backed private equity firm. He argues that the leveraging of political power to secure success for family-members has "been going on for generations" in Washington.
description: Johnson & Johnson faces more than 100,000 lawsuits and has already been ordered to pay out billions in compensation for their products' side effects and for contributing to the opioid crisis
